```{r setup, include=FALSE}
knitr::opts_chunk$set(echo = TRUE)
library(tidyverse)
library(haven)
```

## Data import 

```{r, message=FALSE, warning=FALSE}
nsqipspineCP_1617 = read_csv("./data/nsqipspineCP_1617.csv")
```

note: Where variable type and length disagree, we get error message. Coercion occurs and outcome is all numeric/all character for any given column with longest length.

## Data simplification

```{r}
nsqipspineCP_tidy = nsqipspineCP_1617 %>%
  select(pufyear_x:ped_spn_post_neurodeftype, age_days, sex, height, weight, ethnicity_hispanic, race, transt, ventilat, asthma, hxcld, oxygen_sup, crf, impcogstat, seizure, nutr_support, hemodisorder, asaclas, optime, tothlos, d_opto_dis, death30yn, supinfec, wndinfd, orgspcssi, dehis, oupneumo, pulembol, renainsf, urninfec, cnscoma, cszre, neurodef, cdarrest, othbleed, bleed_ml_tot, othcdiff, othsysep, unplannedreadmission1, reoperation)
```
